TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born on CARDINAL DATE and lives in GPE , GPE

In DATE the applicant was discharged from the army with post traumatic stress disorder ( “ PTSD ” ) . Thereafter , he was involved in a legal dispute with ORG . On DATE and DATE he took part in protests concerning PTSD in GPE . The first protest passed without incident . However , during the second protest he was arrested .

He alleged that he was not informed of the reason for his arrest at the time . The authorities , however , alleged that he was informed that he was being arrested for breach of the peace . According to a subsequent police complaint report there was an independent witness who confirmed the police ’s account .

In any case , he was taken to PERSON ORG , where his particulars were taken , he was fingerprinted , photographed and DNA samples were taken . After TIME he was released from custody and a case alleging ‘ Breach of the Peace’ was submitted to ORG . ORG subsequently decided to discontinue the case .

In DATE the applicant was visited at his home by CARDINAL officers from ORG on an unrelated matter . During the visit the applicant had sight of a document he describes as his “ criminal record ” . On examining this document , he claims that he observed that the case relating to the incident in DATE in GPE was recorded even though no court proceedings had ever taken place .
Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW DATE ( “ the DATE LAW ) provide ( in so far as relevant ) :
“ ( CARDINAL ) It is unlawful for a public authority to act in a way which is incompatible with a Convention right ...
( CARDINAL ) In this section " public authority " includes-
( a ) a court or tribunal , and
( b ) any person certain of whose functions are functions of a public nature , but does not include either ORG of ORG or a person exercising functions in connection with proceedings in ORG ...

CARDINAL . ( CARDINAL ) In relation to any act ( or proposed act ) of a public authority which the court finds is ( or would be ) unlawful , it may grant such relief or remedy , or make such order , within its powers as it considers just and appropriate .
( CARDINAL ) But damages may be awarded only by a court which has power to award damages , or to order the payment of compensation , in civil proceedings .
( a ) any other relief or remedy granted , or order made , in relation to the act in question ( by that or any other court ) , and
( b ) the consequences of any decision ( of that or any other court ) in respect of that act ,
the court is satisfied that the award is necessary to afford just satisfaction to the person in whose favour it is made .
( CARDINAL ) In determining-
( a ) whether to award damages , or
( b ) the amount of an award ,
the court must take into account the principles applied by ORG in relation to the award of compensation under LAW ...
( CARDINAL ) In this section-
" court " includes a tribunal ;
" damages " means damages for an unlawful act of a public authority ; and
" unlawful " means unlawful under section DATE ) . ”
The NORP courts have relied on section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act to make awards of damages ( see R v ORG ex p PERSON [ DATE ] HRLR CARDINAL ) .
